sections.title: Section I
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

sections.title: Section II
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question: In the diagram of an amoeba, the structure used to engulf food particles is
The diagram below shows part of the human alimentary canal. Which two structures produce substances involve in the digestion of fat?
The diagram below shows part of the human alimentary canal. Which numbered structure produces hormones that regulate blood sugar level?
The diagram shows organs associated with breathing in humans. What are the numbered structures?
The diagram below shows a yeast cell. The structure numbered 2 is the
The diagram below shows a developing foetus in the womb. What numbered structure serves as shock absorber?
In the longitudinal section of the heart, which of the following statement is true?
selectableOptions: The aorta carries oxygenated blood out of the left atrium
The wall of the left ventricle is thicker than that of the right ventricle
The tricuspid valve separates the left atrium and left ventricle
A semi-lunar valve prevents backward flow of blood into the right atrium
questions.wordAnswer: The wall of the left ventricle is thicker than that of the right ventricle

questions.question: Below is the diagram of a typical plant cell. Which numbered structures make the protoplasm?
Below is the diagram of a bacterium. Which of the numbered structures are absent in an animal cell?
Which part of the bird's digestive system contains sand and gravels?
Below is the diagram of a potometer. The leafy shoot in the setup is cut under water to:
selectableOptions: Ensure that water enters the xylem
Ensure that no air bubbles enter the xylem
Ensure that no dust particles enter the xylem
Ensure that water does not leave the xylem
questions.wordAnswer: Ensure that no air bubbles enter the xylem

questions.question: Below is the diagram of a joint. The function of the part labeled 4 is to:

sections.title: Section III
sections.directions:
Each question consists of three responses. 
One or more of the response(s) is or are correct. 
Select: 
A. If 1, 2 and 3 are all correct. 
B. If 1 and 2 only are correct. 
C. If 2 and 3 only are correct. 
D. If 1 only is correct.

questions.question: Why are viruses considered as living things?
nonSelectableOptions: They can perform all live processes
They can reproduce on their own

questions.question: Enzyme(s) involved in the formation of recombinant DNA
During over heating of the body;
nonSelectableOptions: The hairs of the skin stand erect
The blood vessels below the skin dilate
There is increased production of sweat

questions.question: After fertilization has taken place in the flowering plant;
nonSelectableOptions: The corolla and calyx wither and fall off
The ovary gradually ripens into a seed

questions.question: The malaria parasite

sections.title: Section IV
sections.directions:
Each question consists of a First and Second statements. 
Choose: 
A. If both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first. 
B. If both statements are True and the second statement is not a correct explanation of the first. 
C. If the first statement is True and the second statement is False. 
D. If the first statement is False and the second statement is True.

twoStatements: Bony fish extract dissolved oxygen from water
Bony fish breathe with their gills
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first

twoStatements: The biscuspid and tricuspid valves close when the ventricles contract
Valves close to prevent back flow of blood
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first

twoStatements: Oxygen is an excretory product of plants
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first

twoStatements: The abiotic factors in an ecosystem include temperature and water
Ecosystems are made up of biotic factors only
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: First statement is True. Second statement is False

twoStatements: Glucagon stimulates the conversion of glucose to glycogen
A rise in glucose level stimulates the release of insulin
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: First statement is False. Second statement is True

sections.title: Section V
sections.directions:
Each question consists of four lettered headings A, B, C and D. 
Select the heading which is closely related to the description.

questions.question: Outward expression of genes
Are plant eaters
One of the inorganic compounds used by plants during photosynthesis
Reduces blood sugar level
Involves extracellular digestion
Another name for anaerobic respiration in a yeast cell
The colour change observed when Biuret's reagent is used to test for the presence of protein:
Conversion of water vapour into liquid water
Increases heart rate when secreted into the blood
An enzyme used to join DNA fragments in genetic engineering

sections.title: Section VI
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question: A laboratory blood test showed that a child was anaemic. Which of the following foods is advisable to include in the child's diet?
Exposed palm wine loses its sweetness after several hours. This is due to:

Lime water turns milky when exhaled air is bubbled through it. This indicates that exhaled air:
As a measure to control malaria, oil is sprayed on standing water. This is to:
selectableOptions: Prevent the adult mosquitoes from flying

questions.question: Plants always occur at the first trophic level in food chains. This is because;
selectableOptions: Plants were the first organisms on earth
Plants are found all over the world
Plants convert solar energy into chemical energy
questions.wordAnswer: Plants convert solar energy into chemical energy

questions.question: In an experiment to show that heat energy is produce during respiration, soaked bean seeds were rinsed in a disinfectant before dividing them into two groups. Why were the seeds rinsed in a disinfectant?
Why is a bean seedling placed on a rotating klinostat during an experiment on Phototropism?
selectableOptions: To ensure high concentration of auxin on illuminated side
To ensure equal distribution of auxin
To ensure high concentration of auxin on the darker side
questions.wordAnswer: To ensure equal distribution of auxin

questions.question: When a Red Blood Cell was allowed in tap water for 30 minutes, it got burst. This is due to:
